definition: double/twice/simultaneous/holding two or more (official) posts at the same time
to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out
use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
to employ both kindness and severity (idiom)

sentences.english: The authorities have used the carrot as well as the stick, upping the rewards paid to winners.
sentences.chinese: 當局軟硬兼施，提高對獲獎者的獎勵。

sentences.english: In phase two, actual, clear-cut and persuasively packaged proposals will be more important.
sentences.chinese: 而在第二階段，作出軟硬兼施的提議更爲重要。

sentences.english: Microsoft could also use ownership of Nokia as a carrot and stick.
sentences.chinese: 微軟通過收購諾基亞，還可以對人軟硬兼施。

sentences.english: Dismantle square group in order to strengthen body resistance and eliminating evil each and concurrently bitter cold that construct add sweet warm curative effect best group.
sentences.chinese: 各拆方組中以扶正祛邪兼施的苦寒加甘溫組療效最佳。

sentences.english: The stick is guaranteed for a year, which is the typical life span of a flip-flop.
sentences.chinese: 軟硬兼施，保證了一年，這是典型的壽命一個觸發器。

definition: to take advantage of the new situation (idiom)/to make the best of new opportunities
to use softness to conquer strength (idiom)
to contain two things at a time/to mingle/to incorporate
brush stroke to the side (calligraphy)/fig. side stroke/lateral thinking
